candidates.title: feat(rust): upgrade heapless to v0.7.1 in signature_core
feat(rust): move and refactor entity
candidates.body:
- Move `Entity` to ockam_entity (had been in ockam due to old dependencies)
- Entity `drop` now calls `stop` on the Entity Context.
- Removed `ProfileUpdate` trait - unclear API and need.
- De-generalized ProfileSet to use `ProfileSync` directly instead of `ProfileTrait`
- Merged `ProfileSet` into Entity.
- Reverted Example 5 to original copy, pre-Entity.
- Introduced Example 5a with Entities and mutual authentication.

candidates.title: Entity Feature
candidates.body:
# Entity Feature Branch - Coordination PR

- Updates Examples 5, 6, 9, 12 to use Entities.
- Improves/experiments with Route building by use of `vec!`
- Secure Channel creation is now done through Entity
- Entity can list its active secure channels

candidates.body: Rebase of https://github.com/ockam-network/ockam/pull/1321

candidates.title: Initial Entity implementation
candidates.body:
This creates a delegating Entity. 

- Entity has a default Profile, and delegates all operations to it
- The Entity type implements `ProfileTrait` 
- ProfileTrait updated to add accessor for a Vault, as well as Clone, Send and static lifetime
- SecureChannel creation refactored to use generic Profile traits instead of `ProfileImpl`. This could move into `Entity` eventually but for now i broke it out into a `SecureChannel` builder. Having Profiles construct the Channels themselves was problematic to the design.

candidates.title: Add -dev pre-release tag
candidates.body:
- Adds `-dev` pre-release tag to all crates.
- Adds a script to do this automatically.

candidates.title: # Release 2021-05-10
candidates.body:
# Release 2021-05-10

Primary feature changes are:
- Renaming of the `#[ockam::async_worker]` to `#[ockam::worker]]`
- Vault creation is now synchronous

candidates.title: Release Automation
candidates.body:
# Release Automation

First pass at automation of current crate release workflow. This script uses a 'release plan' that simply consists of a file with crate names and bump level (minor or patch).

For example:
```
ockam_core minor
ockam_node patch
ockam_vault minor
ockam minor
```

When this plan is given to `release.sh`, the following occurs:

- Changes since the last released are gathered from git into a `Changelog-INCOMING.md` for each updated crate. This file has the correct version and date populated, as well as section headers. All that a maintainer needs to do is place the git log message content into one of the categories, then cut and paste into the real `Changelog.md`

- The version of the crate is incremented using `cargo bump`.
- The `README.md` of the crate is updated to the correct version.
- For all other Ockam crates, dependencies on the releasing crate are updated.
- Lockfiles are regenerated for all changed crates.
- All crates are checked via `cargo check`  and  will fail on problems
- Runs a final `gradle test_rust`.

candidates.title: Spacekookie/tcp api
candidates.body:
This commit makes it possible to start multiple TcpRouters with their respective connection workers.

There is a problem with this approach however, because Ockam Node internally associates a whole _address type_ with a router. This means that per node there _can't_ be more than one router per address type.

candidates.title: build: bump curve25519-dalek from 3.0.2 to 3.1.0 in /implementations/rust/ockam/ockam_vault
candidates.body:
Bumps [curve25519-dalek](https://github.com/dalek-cryptography/curve25519-dalek) from 3.0.2 to 3.1.0.
Changelog

Sourced from curve25519-dalek's changelog.

3.1.0

  • Add support for the Elligator2 encoding for Edwards points.
  • Add two optional formally-verified field arithmetic backends which use the Fiat Crypto project's Rust code, which is generated from proofs of functional correctness checked by the Coq theorem proving system.
  • Add support for additional sizes of precomputed tables for basepoint scalar multiplication.
  • Fix an unused import.
  • Add support for using the zeroize traits with all point types. Note that points are not automatically zeroized on Drop, but that consumers of curve25519-dalek should call these methods manually when needed.
Commits
  • 2ea17d5 Update CHANGELOG and README; bump to 3.1.0.
  • 5eca140 Merge pull request #351 from isislovecruft/fix/cleanup-elligator
  • cecc821 Merge pull request #342 from huitseeker/fiat4_with_u32
  • 35d4eab Merge pull request #349 from huitseeker/modernize_benchmarks
  • b05feec Merge pull request #350 from isislovecruft/develop
  • 0da8f08 Maintain legacy 3.x support for lookup tables.
  • ee90202 Trivial cleanups to Elligator2 encoding.
  • d130b5f [benchmarks-only] Updates the benchmarks
  • cc0c444 Merge branch 'feature/dynamic-table-sizes' into develop
  • 1491f0d Update copyright years.
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view
